name: CAO TECHNICIAN H/F
description:
• Analyser les données reçues en début d’affaire
  • Réaliser la CAO (dessin, placement, routage) des cartes électroniques
  • Appliquer les règles de conception spécifiques au domaine d’application
  • Réaliser les autocontrôles des travaux réalisés
  • Générer les données de sortie des cartes pour la production
  • Créer, actualiser et maintenir à jour les bibliothèques de références ou des banques de données 
  • Saisir des BOM sur l’outil interne
  • Être impliqué dans la conception du schéma pour les choix de composants (obsolescence, disponibilité, compatibilité) et le respect des contraintes du projet (placement, routage, mécanique, encombrement, dissipation thermique…)
  • Assurer l’interface technique avec les clients, les sous-traitants et l’équipe de production
  • Gérer la pré-industrialisation des cartes avec les sous-traitants
  • Compétences sur les logiciels du type Altium et OrCAD Cadence 
  • Connaissances de normes de développement électronique
  • Connaissance des process de fabrication de carte électronique
  • Placement routage de cartes avec signaux numériques, analogiques et RF
  • Avoir une bonne vision générale du produit pour prendre en compte les différentes contraintes
  • Maîtriser les normes qualité, les méthodes de résolution de problèmes 
  • Anglais technique
 
Débutant : bac +2/3 en électronique
Senior : bac +2/3 en électronique avec 5 ans d’expérience- Un salaire et des avantages compétitifs.
- L'opportunité de travailler dans un environnement dynamique et en constante évolution.
- Possibilités de développement professionnel et de croissance.
- Défis professionnels, tâches stimulantes et diversifiées 
- Environnement multiculturel 
- Horaires de travail flexibles et jours de télétravail 
- Atmosphère étendue, boissons chaudes et fruits à disposition

name: Câbleur Electrique et Electromécanique H/F
description:
A partir d'instructions de fabrication, le câbleur électrique et électromécanique H/F monte des éléments électriques ou électromécaniques à l'intérieur d'armoires, d'équipements, de matériels ou sur divers supports (châssis, tableaux, ...). Il peut insérer un sous-ensemble dans un appareil électrique et en compléter le montage. Il / Elle intervient selon les règles de sécurité et les impératifs de production (délai, qualité).

▪ Il / Elle travaille sous la responsabilité du Responsable câbleur électrique et électromécanique. 
 
▪ Il / elle est en relation directe avec l'équipe de production. 

▪ Il / elle travaille en autonomie et/ou en équipe suivant les processus définis.

A partir d'une procédure de montage et des directives du Responsable câbleur électrique, il / elle participe à/au 
:
▪ L'assemblage des pièces mécaniques ; 
▪ L'assemblage de cartes électroniques dans des ensembles mécaniques ; 
▪ Câblage électrique des différents éléments ; 
▪ Dimensionnement et assemblage des supports ; 
▪ La réalisation des connexions électriques ; 
▪ La vérification de la conformité des produits finis 
.
Il / Elle peut réaliser les tests de fonctionnalités.
  • Savoir utiliser des outillages manuels
  • Savoir utiliser des appareils de mesure électrique (multimètre,...)
  • Lecture de plans et de schémas
  • Connaissance des normes de sécurité électrique
  • Technique de soudure
  • Règles de montage électrique 
  • Montage mécanique
  • Connaissances informatiques de base
  • Etre méticuleux, appliqué, organisé et manuel

Vous   êtes titulaire d'un CAP / BEP   à   dominante   Electronique   ou 
 justifiez d' une  première expérience dans le domaine du montage / câblage électronique .- Un salaire et des avantages compétitifs.
- L'opportunité de travailler dans un environnement dynamique et en constante évolution.
- Possibilités de développement professionnel et de croissance.
- Défis professionnels, tâches stimulantes et diversifiées 
- Environnement multiculturel 
- Horaires de travail flexibles et jours de télétravail 
- Atmosphère étendue, boissons chaudes et fruits à disposition

name: Development Technical Lead
description:
Are you ready to lead cutting-edge development projects and drive technical excellence in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? 
We’re looking for a Development Technical Lead who thrives on solving complex challenges, mentoring high-performing teams, and delivering scalable, high-quality software solutions. Join us to play a key role in shaping innovative products that impact thousands of users — all within a collaborative and forward-thinking culture. 

Technical Lead Role 

  • provide technical leadership, guidance, and accountability for the deliverables of the agile team
  • actively contribute as a member of the team, writing high-quality code and participating in code reviews
  • maintain code quality and mentor team members to continuously improve team performance
  • foster an inclusive, collaborative environment that encourages knowledge-sharing and innovation
  • design and oversee the implementation of technical solutions, ensuring scalability, maintainability and alignment with the organization’s architectural principles
  • collaborate with the Architects and other Tech Leads to maintain technical consistency, share updates, discuss technical challenges and address cross-team dependencies
  • work closely with Product Owners to provide technical input during early stages of product planning, including high-level effort estimations for new features or initiatives
  • ensure that implemented features meet business needs, technical requirements, and quality expectations
  • proactively identify and mitigate risks that may affect feature delivery or technical integrity
Team Leadership – Optional
  • motivate team members by setting clear goals, providing regular feedback, and recognizing achievements
  • mentor team members by offering guidance, support, and opportunities for growth and learning
  • hold regular one-on-one reviews to evaluate individual progress, provide constructive feedback, and align with career development paths
  • actively resolve conflicts and mediate tensions, fostering a respectful and constructive team culture
  • maintain open and transparent communication, ensuring team members are aligned and informed
  • participate in the recruitment process, including screening, interviewing, and evaluating candidates

Required qualifications and skills 

  • college or university degree
  • at least 5-year experience as a software developer
  • high level expertise in C#, .NET Core, and Entity Framework Core
  • deep understanding of relational database design and development using Microsoft SQL Server
  • strong knowledge of REST (ASP.NET Web API) and SOAP (WCF)
  • experience in microservice architecture design
  • proficient in Git, including branching strategies
  • familiarity with the principles of secure system engineering
  • good professional English (spoken and written)
Advantages 
  • proficiency in developing, deploying, and debugging applications using Azure App Services and Azure Functions
  • design, develop, and deploy scalable applications leveraging containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
  • knowledge of VoIP technologies (SIP, RTP)
  • experience in DevOps or continuous delivery approach
  • people management background


We are offering 

  • Professional challenges, inspiring, diverse tasks
  • structured development process
  • learning path on new technologies (AI, LLM)
  • multiculture environment
  • flexible working hours and home office days
  • relaxed atmosphere, steady, supportive international team
  • easily accessible modern office with good infrastructure
  • complimentary coffee, fruit and snacks

name: Ingénieur Radio H/F
description:
Vous apportez votre savoir-faire sur la mise en œuvre du système de détection et de neutralisation de communication :
  • Vous intervenez en milieu carcéral pour réaliser des mesures sur les différents réseaux 2G/3G/4G/5G des opérateurs, mais aussi sur des réseaux WiFi.
  • Sur la base de ces mesures, vous dimensionnez les besoins en équipements en fonction de l'architecture des sites.
  • Vous travaillez en collaboration étroite avec les équipes de travaux et les responsables du déploiement pour adapter les implantations aux spécificités de chaque site.
  • Vous assurez, en collaboration avec les Ingénieurs Radios en poste et les responsables du déploiement, le suivi technique des chantiers et vous contrôlez les attentes en termes radio tout au long des travaux.
  • Vous êtes en charge des paramètres des appareils installés et vous contrôlez leur performance lors de la mise en service, et tout au long de la vie des sites.
  • Vous êtes amené à faire des diagnostics sur les performances du système ou à sa bonne cohabitation avec les systèmes radios existants sur site. Le cas échéant, vous proposez des optimisations et participez à leur mise en œuvre.
En complément de ces missions du quotidien :
  • Vous travaillez en équipe avec les équipes du fournisseur de matériel qui participent à l'amélioration des appareils et au développement de nouvelles technologies (5G, WiFi 7 etc…).
  • Vous apportez votre expérience dans le domaine des télécommunications pour faire évoluer les moyens mis en œuvre pour mener à bien la mission de détection et de neutralisation.
  • Vous êtes en lien avec le client ou ses représentants, ainsi que les organismes de régulation publics (ANFR…) pour assurer le suivi des activités de détection et de neutralisation.
Prévoir de nombreux déplacements (50% du temps).
Poste Cadre
Convention collective de la métallurgie
  • De formation Ecole d’Ingénieurs (Telecom Saint-Etienne, etc.), vous bénéficiez d’une expérience réussie de +/- 5 ans en radiotransmission et dimensionnement de réseaux télécoms. 
  • Vous êtes imprégnés des technologies de pointe : électronique, radiofréquence, transmissions, telecom, microélectronique, informatique, optoélectronique, etc. 
  • Vous maîtrisez les différentes techniques de gestion et d’organisation, de R& D de l’entreprise. A cet égard, vous ne cessez d’œuvrer pour le développement des techniques de communication, telle la numérisation du signal ou le développement de la commutation. 
- Un salaire et des avantages compétitifs.
- L'opportunité de travailler dans un environnement dynamique et en constante évolution.
- Possibilités de développement professionnel et de croissance.
- Défis professionnels, tâches stimulantes et diversifiées 
- Environnement multiculturel 
- Horaires de travail flexibles et jours de télétravail 
- Atmosphère étendue, boissons chaudes et fruits à disposition

name: Medior Tester
description:
Are you an experienced Lead software tester, ready to take the next step in your career?

You like exciting projects and working as a core member of an international team?

Are you interested in the telecommunications industry?

As a member of our team you will participate in manual and automated testing, validating, specifying and documenting of the IT and telecommunication systems produced and operated by our company. You will take an active part in test planning, test case development and test group leading. You will work close with other team members: software developers, product owners, IT professionals and external partners.

Major responsibilities and tasks

  • Managing the design, implementation and execution of functional and non functional tests.
  • Support Integration and Regression testing.
  • Maintain test environments and participate in CI/CD related activities.
  • Executing the manual & automated tests in the short term, and automate the manual tests in the medium term.
  • Analyzing test results on database impacts, errors or bugs, and usability.
  • Preparing test documentation.
  • Validating specifications and setup guides.
  • Taking active part in test planning, test case development. 
  • Working closely with other team members: architects, product owners, software developers, IT and external partners.

Required qualifications and skills

  • at least 3-5 year experience as a software tester
  • experience in non-functional testing (Performance, Security)
  • strong experience in troubleshooting 
  • strong knowledge and experience in automated testing (not only UI Automation but API as well)
  • strong analytical, engineering, and technology skills that include practical application, techniques, and principles
  • knowledge of test methods 
  • high level expertise in using test management software
  • independent problem-solving skills and product focused way of thinking 
  • good command of English

 

Required:

  • Microsoft technologies (Windows infrastructure, IIS)
  • Database basics (SQL/MSSQL)
  • API Testing Tool (e.g.: Postman, SoapUI) 
  • Manual testing

Advantage:
  • BSc, MSc or higher level in Computer Science
  • Telco experience
  • Programming basics (C#/.NET)
  • Atlassian JIRA/Confluence
  • Robotframework
  • Linux knowledge
  • VOIP
  • ISTQB certification (any level)
  • Non-Functional Testing tool (e.g.: JMeter)
  • Experience in mobile application testing



We are offering

  • professional challenges, inspiring, diverse tasks
  • structured development process
  • learning path on new technologies (AI, LLM)
  • multiculture environment
  • flexible working hours and home office days
  • relaxed atmosphere, steady, supportive international team
  • easily accessible modern office with good infrastructure
  • complimentary coffee, fruits and snacks

name: Network Engineer (m/f/d)
keywords: Network Configuration,Network Infrastructure Protection,Network Solutions,IT Support Specialist,Network Performance Optimization,Network Documentation
description:
• Network Installation and Support: Install, configure and support network environments using technologies like Extreme Networks, Cisco, and Fortinet.
  • Firewall Management: Install, configure and support firewalls, including Fortigate and Cisco, to protect network infrastructure.
  • Design and Administration: Design, implement and administer customer network environments, ensuring high availability, performance and resilience.
  • Second-Level IT Support: Provide 2nd Level IT Support for local field services, troubleshooting complex network issues and maintaining seamless operations.
  • Network Monitoring and Administration: Monitor and administer local network environments, optimizing performance and ensuring security.
  • Incident Management: Manage, document and resolve incidents using the Jira ticketing system.
  • Network Optimization and Upgrades: Assess network performance and implement upgrades, including firmware updates and hardware replacements.
  • Documentation and Reporting: Maintain comprehensive documentation and generate regular reports on network performance.
  • Disaster Recovery Planning: Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans for network infrastructure.
  • Network Audit and Compliance Checks: Conduct regular network audits to ensure compliance with regulations.
  • International Team Collaboration: Collaborate with an international IT team on cross-border projects.
  • Standby Participation: Participate in standby duties.
  • You hold certifications for network devices such as CISCO-CCNA, Fortinet, or Extreme Certified Associate.
  • You possess more than 3 years of experience as a network engineer.
  • You have more than 3 years of experience working in an international team as a network engineer.
  • Your background includes experience in the administration of phone systems (not required but advantageous).
  • You have a strong understanding of centrally managed network systems and environments.
  • Your strength lies in your technical documentation skills.
  • You are proficient in Portuguese and English, both spoken and written.
  • Open corporate culture: Immerse yourself in an international working environment where ideas and diversity are encouraged.
  • Collegial working atmosphere: Enjoy a working atmosphere characterised by collaboration and a hands-on mentality
  • Meal allowance through vouchers/card
  • Company health insurance plan

name: Senior System Engineer (m/f/d)
keywords: Systems Engineering,Technical Innovation,Collaboration,Security Clearance,Hardware Management,Troubleshooting,Active Directory,Network Security,IT Service Management
description:
As a Senior System Engineer of Telio you are responsible for the optimal availability of the Telio systems and the applications in our highly complex environments. Together with deeply skilled co-workers throughout the company, you will take care of maintenance, timely identification issues and troubleshooting. You plan, coordinate, and implement the various measures and contribute by actively brainstorming, looking critically, and coming up with suggestions for improvements to enhance the quality of our servers.
The daily operational activities consist of the following tasks:

  • Server Management: Setup, configure and maintain server environments for optimal performance.
  • Infrastructure Maintenance: Perform routine updates and maintenance.
  • VMware Management: Ensure high availability and performance of VMware infrastructure.
  • Second Level Support Collaboration: Guide and support the Second Level Support team to help them assist their customers effectively.
  • Proactive System Monitoring: Proactively monitor systems and networks to prevent issues, implement solutions to prevent downtime or performance degradation.
  • Backup and Recovery: Manage backup solutions and test recovery procedures. Ensure backups are performed and recovery procedures are tested and documented.
  • Incident Management: Lead resolution efforts for complex incidents to ensure minimal impact on operations.
  • Asset Management: Maintain hardware and software inventory, ensuring compliance.
  • Audit and Compliance: Conduct audits to ensure policy and regulatory compliance.
  • Documentation and Design: Create and maintain network-related documentation (e.g. design specifications, installation instructions, procedures, checklists).
  • International Collaboration: Work with global IT teams on cross-border projects.
  • Standby Duties: Participate in standby duties.
  • Education: You hold a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (preferred) or similar.
  • Experience: You bring over five years of experience in system administration, IT system architecture, network management, or a related field.
  • Technical Expertise:
    • Your strength lies in your extensive knowledge of Windows operating systems, including Active Directory, Windows Server, back-office products, and workstations.
    • VMware virtualization is a key area of expertise for you.
    • You are well-versed in Confluence and Jira.
    • Linux operating systems are a strength of yours.
    • Experience with cloud services such as AWS and Microsoft Azure is a valuable asset you possess.
    • You have a solid background in monitoring systems.
    • Administration of phone systems is an advantageous skill you have, though not required.
  • Skills:
    • Your communication and technical documentation skills are excellent.
    • You are proficient in English, both spoken and written.
We are offering a stable yet very diverse working environment with an outstanding team spirit and atmosphere. If you love working in a very diverse and technical environment, at a great location in Amsterdam, with an awesome international team, this is the job for you! Next to these amazing perks, we offer: 
  • An attractive salary package based on knowledge and skills
  • 8% vacation pay
  • A high level of autonomy
  • Professional challenges, exciting, diverse tasks
  • Continuous professional development and training with career growth opportunities
  • Flexible working hours and home office days
  • Relaxed atmosphere, steady, supportive international team

name: Service Center Expert (m/f/d)
keywords: Field Service,Customer Service, First Level Support,Customer
description:
Do you like to have an impact on customer experience? Are you the ‘spider in the web’ who connects services and processes with clients? Is the answer yes and yes? Then this opportunity is for you.
 
As a service center expert you will be part of the international service center of Telio Group. Based in our beautiful Amsterdam offices, in a relaxed atmosphere you will work closely with other colleagues from the service team, the Country Manager Netherlands and the rest of the supportive international Telio team.

What does that mean exactly?
  
  • Our face to the customer: you will answer requests and questions by e-mail, telephone and our Service portal and advise our users on appropriate actions
  • Problem solver: you will solve minor technical issues or escalate them to our second level Technical Services and IT  
  • Validate, classify, prioritize: continuous incident communication till the resolution  
  • Everything on track: you keep the service level agreement (SLA) and achieve a high first contact resolution (FCR). You create, develop and communicate reports, such as root cause analysis and follow standard service center procedures, and keep track of tickets in JIRA  
  • Our expert: you will get a comprehensive understanding of our products and enhance the Service Center knowledge base  
  • New ideas welcome: you identify operational and service improvements to further improve our customer experience
  • There for our customers: shift work during weekdays, on-call duty for off-hours and weekends, willingness to do client site visits from time to time
  • Professional, emphatic and fun person to work with!  
  • Extensive service center experience, ideally in the field of telecommunication and/or IT
  • Excellent communication skills (spoken and written)  
  • Fluent Dutch and English is a must (upper intermediate B2)  
  • Good task management & work organization, ability to work independently
  • Confident mastery of Microsoft Office products, working with Jira (or another ticketing system is an advance)
  • Living in or not too far from Amsterdam. Partly working from home is possible   
We offer you a stable yet very diverse working environment with an outstanding team spirit and atmosphere.
If you love working in a very diverse and technical environment, at a great location in Amsterdam, within an awesome international team, this is the job for you!
 
Next to these amazing perks we offer:
  • An attractive salary package: we honour your performance appropriately
  • Enough time to relax: 26+ vacation days
  • A high level of autonomy
  • It will never get boring: professional challenges, exciting, diverse tasks
  • Opportunity to grow: continuous professional development and training with career growth opportunities
  • Office + home work: mix between working in our beautiful Amsterdam office + home office days
  • The greatest colleagues: relaxed atmosphere, steady, supportive international team
Interested in joining our team? If so, we look forward to receiving your application.

name: Service Coordinator EU West
description:
Your Key Responsibilities are:

  • Inventory Management:

    • Monitor and manage inventory levels using internal database tools (e.g., SAGE).

    • Record all inventory movements, tracking stock, orders, sales, and deliveries to maintain optimal stock levels.

    • Order inventory from suppliers.

    • Oversee the storage and organization of inventory across multiple warehouses, ensuring efficient space management.

    • Analyze historical data to forecast future customer demand and ensure inventory availability.

  • Supply Chain Coordination:

    • Collaborate with suppliers, manufacturers, and distributors to ensure the smooth flow of goods throughout the supply chain (internally and externally).

    • Optimize supply chain processes and improve the operational efficiency.

  • Compliance & Reporting:

    • Ensure compliance with internal policies and external procurement and industry regulations.

    • Assist with the preparation of operational reports.

    • Provide strategic insights and data-driven recommendations.

  • You report to the Team Lead Service Management EU West.

Join us if your profile suits with the followings:

  • Proficiency in MS Office tools, especially Excel and PowerPoint, ensuring efficient and well-structured work.

  • Educational background in Business Administration or Supply Chain Management.

  • Experience with Salesforce or SAGE is an added value.

  • Good organizational skills – able to manage diverse tasks effectively.

  • Strong communication skills – clear, professional, and adaptable to different audiences.

  • Languages: English and French (spoken and written); Dutch is a plus.


In accordance to the Belgian Law we offer our employees:

  • 20 days vacation.
  • Vacation pay: You get 92% of one monthly gross as vacation pay.
  • Holiday pay: You get 1 month salary in December on top.
Additionally we provide:
  • You receive Pluxee meal vouchers for your working days.
  • A gym corner in the office.
  • A company phone with contract.
  • Snacks and drinks in the office.

name: Service Desk Engineer
description:
At our Service Desk, the following responsibilities are part of your role:

  • Being the first point of contact for customer requests.

  • Collaborating with internal teams and external partners to solve issues.

  • Understanding and documenting requests, following standard procedures.

  • Providing advice, resolving minor issues, and escalating when needed.

  • Keeping tickets and the knowledge base up to date.

  • Classifying and prioritizing incidents, ensuring timely communication and resolution.

  • Aiming for high first contact resolution and meeting SLAs.

  • Working in shifts on weekdays, with on-call duties during evenings and weekends.

Join us if

  • You've spent a few years in a service-oriented role and you enjoy helping others.

  • You have great customer experiences and keeping things running smoothly.

  • You are organized, manage your own workload, and take own initiative.

  • You’re comfortable with Microsoft Office products – and bonus is if you’ve used Jira or Salesforce before.

  • You can express yourself clearly, whether it’s in French and English. Dutch would be an additional benefit.

  • You’re flexible when it comes to working hours and can handle with schedule changes

In accordance to the Belgian Law we offer our employees:

  • 20 days vacation.
  • Vacation pay: You get 92% of one monthly gross as vacation pay.
  • Holiday pay: You get 1 month salary in December on top.
Additionally we provide:
  • You receive Pluxee meal vouchers for your working days.
  • A gym corner in the office.
  • A company phone with contract.
  • Snacks and drinks in the office.
